page.title: 06Farming around Cranbrook
page.content: Most of the farms deal with hops,fruit and cereals.Livestock such as sheep, pigs and cattle are kept on some farms. Horses are reared at Goddards Green stud.The hop gardens for a long time a feature of this area have declined in recent years. Fruit,especially apples,cherries and strawberries are sent to London or to local markets. Some farmers have found it more profitable to adopt a "pick your own" method of selling thereby avoiding unnecessary costs.Farm sizes average from 50 to 500 acres.They are well stocked with equipment,many farmers find that common market policies have effected their policies,and forced them to change what they farm.This has in some cases led to a decline in hop and apple growing,and a reduction in some dairy farming.
